Text.Value: I already gave you my answer - forget the spear.
Attack.
But I felt her presence - Lady Shar. Why did she choose you?
Now go. Warm my blade with moon-crazed blood. And be wary of your companion - he pries in your thoughts.
Now go. Warm my blade with moon-crazed blood. And be wary of your companion - she pries in your thoughts.
Now go. Warm my blade with moon-crazed blood. And be wary of your companion - they pry in your thoughts.
When the time comes for me to do my duty, stand aside.
I'm glad you changed your mind. Otherwise that would have been the end for us. I don't want it to be the end.

EditorData.NodeContext: Genuine - she's relieved a player she has high respect for changed their minds. Otherwise it would have ended in combat

Text.Value: You're here to kill a child of Selûne - I heard it all. And I can't let that happen.
Lady Shar. She came to me as I prayed. She told me what needs to be done.

EditorData.NodeContext: Focused. She's just been commanded to to this by her goddess, who reached out to her through her thoughts. Arc: SH loyal to Shar.

Text.Value: *She pays you no heed, remaining on her knees.*
It's not for me to question that - or for you. We live to serve.
Yes, you could have. Don't pretend otherwise.
Let's calm down. We'll talk about it later.
Really? That was fast.
*You feel your mind slip into Shadowheart's - but you are not the only one present. There is another - ancient, commanding, rendered from purest darkness. Shar.*
...Find my spear, step forward, and strike down the Selûnite.
There's something you're not telling me.
There's something I need to do once we enter the Dark Lady's domain. Any more meddling on your part will end badly.
All right, no need to dash in ahead of me - I'm ready.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart opens her eyes, raises her head, and stands.

Text.Value: You will not stand in my way. Draw your weapon.
This must be the last step. I need to pray. Only by Lady Shar's grace did we even make it this far.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart kneels before the pool and bows her head in prayer.

Text.Value: Forget it. We're not going to sacrifice a life to Shar.
As you command, Nightsinger.
I'm sorry, I couldn't help myself.
I do. I'm amazed you missed the signs, honestly.

EditorData.NodeContext: All business. The player failed to learn she worships Shar until quite late in the story, beyond the point where secrecy matters.

Text.Value: Back to the library it is.
*You feel her mind flare in anger - she's sensed your intrusion.*
*Nothing. Shadowheart continues her prayer in silence.*
Use the power of the parasite. Feel inside Shadowheart's mind.
Good. Somewhere in the library there should be an image of my Lady that we can shroud in darkness. The spear should reveal itself.
Not that it matters, but her reward aligns with your own interests.
Leave her to her prayers.

EditorData.stateContext: Shadowheart is kneeling, (both knees in contact with the floor, hands resting flat on her thighs, head bowed and eyes closed in prayer.)

Text.Value: All right. Fine. Let's move on.
I don't care about the spear - I'm continuing.
No. Not yet. We can't go on - not without the Spear of Night. We must return to the library.
That wasn't for you to hear.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The mindmeld connection severs abruptly as Shadowheart stands and glares at the player, furious.

Text.Value: Onwards, then.
We're not ready yet - we must find that spear.
It's simple - I have a mission. It need not concern you - and as long as you don't interfere, it'll bring you no harm.
With good reason, it seems.
Please. Don't make me do this - not after all we've been through.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This node only if SH meets a certain approval threshold of the player
EditorData.NodeContext: Imploring someone she respects to change their mind, or she'll be forced to attack them

Text.Value: Now let me pray. This is important.

EditorData.NodeContext: All business. The player failed to learn she worships Shar until quite late in the story, beyond the point where secrecy matters.

Text.Value: Lady... Shar? You worship her...?
What's going on?
Just remember what I said - let me do what I need to.
It's simple. My Lady Shar demands a sacrifice. One life.
...Take my spear, step forward, and strike down the Selûnite.
Some prayers are answered more quickly than others. Let's continue.
I'm sorry, I couldn't help myself.
You'd be wise to turn a blind eye. I won't fail - not when I'm this close.
There is something I need, before we continue - the Spear of Night. We can find it in the Library.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart opens her eyes, raises her head, and stands.
EditorData.NodeContext: Focused. She's just been commanded to to this by her goddess, who reached out to her through her thoughts. Arc: SH loyal to Shar.

Text.Value: I gave you every chance. Now you've forced my hand.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hard-edged resignation. Turns hostile against the player after this.

Text.Value: There'll be time to pray later - let's move.
We need to focus on our main goal.
Can't I even pray without interference?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The mindmeld connection severs abruptly as Shadowheart stands and glares at the player, furious.

Text.Value: I'm sorry. I serve the Dark Lady. I'll dedicate the loss of you to her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Regretful, but she's still going to turn hostile to the player after this all the same.

EditorData.stateContext: Shadowheart is kneeling, (both knees in contact with the floor, hands resting flat on her thighs, head bowed and eyes closed in prayer.)

Text.Value: What? You just learned that while praying...?
Whatever you think you're going to do in there - forget it.
Say nothing.
I deserve to know what I'm getting myself into.
Nothing, just a show of respect. Trust me, you wouldn't want to displease her. Not here. Let's continue.
The tadpole, you mean? It's not that simple, not anymore. The Nightsinger herself has made her will known. She comes before all others.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little unsure. She understands this seems like a sudden course-correction.

EditorData.logicalname: Visual State (blank to clear previous visual state)

Text.Value: Fine - we'll go look for the spear first.
There's something I need to do once we enter the Dark Lady's domain. Just don't interfere - it's important.
My Lady does not want you to.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ultimatum/threat. She'll turn hostile if the player persists in ignoring her wishes here.

Text.Value: Please. How many breathed their last just so we could make it this far? Trust me. This will help us.
Shadowheart...?
One life is too high a price.

Synopsis:
If Shar/Shadowheart have told the player about the Spear of Night, they will be given once last reminder to find it before entering the Shadowfell. If the player refuses twice, SH will turn hostile

COM: Shadowheart refuses to enter the Shadowfell without the spear. If the player refuses to search for it then Shadowheart leaves the party
